content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
Jihad T. Abbas, MD, is a board certified general & vascular surgeon with ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular, and a Clinical Associate Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo Department of Surgery. Dr. Abbas has a special interest in aortic diseases, carotid diseases, and wound care and limb salvage.
Dr. Abbas and his wife, Kimberly, have three sons. Dr. Abbas is a graduate of The American University of Beirut, and is fluent in English, as well as, Arabic and French. He has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In their spare time, both Dr. and Mrs. Abbas are involved in community service and enjoy traveling abroad. He has been on the faculty at the University of Toledo for the last 18 years of his professional life.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of Beirut, Lebanon
ResidencyMedical College of Georgia Hospital and Clinics
ResidencyNew York University Medical Center/Bellevue Hospital

content.biography:
I specialize in adult heart disease with personalized, honest, competent & compassionate care in a single specialty group setting. I was born & raised in India, trained in the USA and in private practice in Oregon, OH since 1995, with active participation in local hospitals med staff. Past President of Medical Staff at Bay Park Hospital from 2018 – 2020.
More About Ravi Adusumilli, MD, FACC
Ravi Adusumilli, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.
Dr. Adusumilli is board-certified in cardiology.
Care philosophy: He believes in personalized, honest, competent, and compassionate care.
Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, heart failure, atrial fibrillation, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension.
Procedures/treatments performed: Stress testing, echocardiogram, and nuclear testing.

title: Shaheen Alam MD - Psychiatry - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Shaheen Alam MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
5800 Monroe St.
Suite G
Sylvania, OH 43560

content.biography:
Shaheen Alam, MD is a licensed psychiatrist. Dr. Alam is fellowship-trained in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry from the Brookdale University Hospital Medical Center in New York and received her doctorate from Tohoku University School of Medicine in Sendai, Japan.

She has had numerous articles and abstracts published in peer reviewed journals in addition to making many scientific psychiatric presentations.

Care Philosophy: Dr. Alam emphasizes the successful doctor-patient relationship, which is critical in mental health management. She also loves working in a multicultural environment, solving problems and facing challenges together with her patients.

Patients and Conditions treated: In addition to treating adults, families and individuals, Dr. Alam specializes in treating children and adolescents.

Some of the conditions she treats are: depression, anxiety, psychosis, bipolar, employee mental health, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

More about me: Dr. Alam enjoys spending time with her family and practicing dance. She was the National Folk Dance Champion in Bangladesh three times.
education: Medical SchoolChittagong Medical College, Chittagong, Bangladesh
ResidencyBrookdale University Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York
FellowshipBrookdale University Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York
Doctoral StudiesTohoku University School of Medicine, Sendai, Japan

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
Jihad T. Abbas, MD, is a board certified general & vascular surgeon with ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular, and a Clinical Associate Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo Department of Surgery. Dr. Abbas has a special interest in aortic diseases, carotid diseases, and wound care and limb salvage.
Dr. Abbas and his wife, Kimberly, have three sons. Dr. Abbas is a graduate of The American University of Beirut, and is fluent in English, as well as, Arabic and French. He has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In their spare time, both Dr. and Mrs. Abbas are involved in community service and enjoy traveling abroad. He has been on the faculty at the University of Toledo for the last 18 years of his professional life.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of Beirut, Lebanon
ResidencyMedical College of Georgia Hospital and Clinics
ResidencyNew York University Medical Center/Bellevue Hospital

content.biography:
I specialize in adult heart disease with personalized, honest, competent & compassionate care in a single specialty group setting. I was born & raised in India, trained in the USA and in private practice in Oregon, OH since 1995, with active participation in local hospitals med staff. Past President of Medical Staff at Bay Park Hospital from 2018 – 2020.
More About Ravi Adusumilli, MD, FACC
Ravi Adusumilli, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.
Dr. Adusumilli is board-certified in cardiology.
Care philosophy: He believes in personalized, honest, competent, and compassionate care.
Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, heart failure, atrial fibrillation, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension.
Procedures/treatments performed: Stress testing, echocardiogram, and nuclear testing.
education: ResidencyInternal Medicine | Ball Memorial Hospital (Muncie, IN)

title: Shaheen Alam MD - Psychiatry - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Shaheen Alam MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
5800 Monroe St.
Suite G
Sylvania, OH 43560

content.biography:
Shaheen Alam, MD is a licensed psychiatrist. Dr. Alam is fellowship-trained in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry from the Brookdale University Hospital Medical Center in New York and received her doctorate from Tohoku University School of Medicine in Sendai, Japan.

She has had numerous articles and abstracts published in peer reviewed journals in addition to making many scientific psychiatric presentations.

Care Philosophy: Dr. Alam emphasizes the successful doctor-patient relationship, which is critical in mental health management. She also loves working in a multicultural environment, solving problems and facing challenges together with her patients.

Patients and Conditions treated: In addition to treating adults, families and individuals, Dr. Alam specializes in treating children and adolescents.

Some of the conditions she treats are: depression, anxiety, psychosis, bipolar, employee mental health, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

More about me: Dr. Alam enjoys spending time with her family and practicing dance. She was the National Folk Dance Champion in Bangladesh three times.
education: Medical SchoolChittagong Medical College, Chittagong, Bangladesh
ResidencyBrookdale University Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York
FellowshipBrookdale University Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York
Doctoral StudiesTohoku University School of Medicine, Sendai, Japan

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
Jihad T. Abbas, MD, is a board certified general & vascular surgeon with ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular, and a Clinical Associate Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo Department of Surgery. Dr. Abbas has a special interest in aortic diseases, carotid diseases, and wound care and limb salvage.
Dr. Abbas and his wife, Kimberly, have three sons. Dr. Abbas is a graduate of The American University of Beirut, and is fluent in English, as well as, Arabic and French. He has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In their spare time, both Dr. and Mrs. Abbas are involved in community service and enjoy traveling abroad. He has been on the faculty at the University of Toledo for the last 18 years of his professional life.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of Beirut, Lebanon
ResidencyMedical College of Georgia Hospital and Clinics
ResidencyNew York University Medical Center/Bellevue Hospital

5800 Monroe St.

content.biography:
Shaheen Alam, MD is a licensed psychiatrist. Dr. Alam is fellowship-trained in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry from the Brookdale University Hospital Medical Center in New York and received her doctorate from Tohoku University School of Medicine in Sendai, Japan.

She has had numerous articles and abstracts published in peer reviewed journals in addition to making many scientific psychiatric presentations.

Care Philosophy: Dr. Alam emphasizes the successful doctor-patient relationship, which is critical in mental health management. She also loves working in a multicultural environment, solving problems and facing challenges together with her patients.

Patients and Conditions treated: In addition to treating adults, families and individuals, Dr. Alam specializes in treating children and adolescents.

Some of the conditions she treats are: depression, anxiety, psychosis, bipolar, employee mental health, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).

More about me: Dr. Alam enjoys spending time with her family and practicing dance. She was the National Folk Dance Champion in Bangladesh three times.

title: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Tracy L. Bartson, APRN, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.Philosophy of care: To hone into the individual needs of each woman while encouraging autonomy by being active participants in their care plan.  Tracy's goal is to empower women with up-to-date education and evidenced-based practice while instilling confidence in their ability to achieve healthy outcomes. She assures respect and privacy while promoting involvement of significant others per patient consent.Clinical interests: Education to adolescents and young adults on the variety of norms of the female reproductive system and sexual health. For pregnant and laboring patients, education on the impact of daily exercise and Spinning Babies techniques in regards to maintaining comfort and healthy outcomes. Additionally, helping women navigate the challenges of menopause with safe appropriate use of hormone replacement therapy and adjunct medication.More about me: Tracy enjoys nature. It keeps her grounded to be outdoors hiking, camping, backpacking, kayaking and gardening. Tracy's outlook is that inclement weather should not hold her back. Maintaining a calm, positive attitude in harsh conditions keeps her prepared for challenges in other areas of life.
education: Associates in NursingUniversity of Toledo ComTech

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.



Dr. Baxter is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is a Fellow with the American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. 



Special procedures that Dr. Baxter performs include: Hyoid suspension for sleep apnea, snoring injection procedure, sialoendoscopy, eustachian tuboplasty, cosmetic and functional rhinoplasty, otoplasty.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine

content.name: Meghan Beck PA-C

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedics l Trauma and Adult Reconstruction

content.biography: Meghan Beck, PA-C is an orthopedic physician assistant that has been working in the acute orthopededic trauma setting since 2010. She manages orthopedic trauma inpatients and outpatients both independently and in collaboration with our orthopedic trauma attendings. Meghan is also first assist in the operating room. She also treats patients for primary and secondary fracture prevention in a bone health program.Meghan's philosophy of care involves providing evidence based, best practice care while also treating patients as she would want to be treated. She obtained her Bachelor’s degree from the University of Dayton while also being a member of their division 1 women’s soccer program. Meghan returned to Toledo to obtain her Master’s degree at the University of Toledo in their physician assistant program. She completed a fracture liaison certificate through the national osteoporosis foundation. In 2018, Meghan was awarded a risk management grant to create a fracture liaison service at ProMedica to improve the quality of fracture prevention care for patients that have sustained a fragility fracture. She also helped create a secondary fracture prevention program to help manage patients who are at increased risk for additional fracturesMeghan grew up in Toledo and returned to raise her family and provide orthopedic care to her community.

content.biography: Karl Beer, MD provides comprehensive care for patients with arthritis of the hip or knee including evaluation, x-rays, injections as well as surgical repair. He treats arthritic hips and knees with conservative measures (medication, therapy, injections) until the patient reaches end stage disease causing disabling pain and loss of function of involved joint. Dr. Beer participated in advanced training to learn the Anterior Total Hip procedure at age 55 and is certified in the Oxford Partial Knee Advanced instructional courseHe states that his spiritual life is very important to him and he tries to incorporate it in his professional life by being aware of his patients’ spiritual needs.

title: Meghan Beck PA-C - Orthopaedic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Meghan Beck PA-C
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedics l Trauma and Adult Reconstruction
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedics l Trauma and Adult Reconstruction

content.biography: Meghan Beck, PA-C is an orthopedic physician assistant that has been working in the acute orthopededic trauma setting since 2010. She manages orthopedic trauma inpatients and outpatients both independently and in collaboration with our orthopedic trauma attendings. Meghan is also first assist in the operating room. She also treats patients for primary and secondary fracture prevention in a bone health program.Meghan's philosophy of care involves providing evidence based, best practice care while also treating patients as she would want to be treated. She obtained her Bachelor’s degree from the University of Dayton while also being a member of their division 1 women’s soccer program. Meghan returned to Toledo to obtain her Master’s degree at the University of Toledo in their physician assistant program. She completed a fracture liaison certificate through the national osteoporosis foundation. In 2018, Meghan was awarded a risk management grant to create a fracture liaison service at ProMedica to improve the quality of fracture prevention care for patients that have sustained a fragility fracture. She also helped create a secondary fracture prevention program to help manage patients who are at increased risk for additional fracturesMeghan grew up in Toledo and returned to raise her family and provide orthopedic care to her community.

content.biography: Karl Beer, MD provides comprehensive care for patients with arthritis of the hip or knee including evaluation, x-rays, injections as well as surgical repair. He treats arthritic hips and knees with conservative measures (medication, therapy, injections) until the patient reaches end stage disease causing disabling pain and loss of function of involved joint. Dr. Beer participated in advanced training to learn the Anterior Total Hip procedure at age 55 and is certified in the Oxford Partial Knee Advanced instructional courseHe states that his spiritual life is very important to him and he tries to incorporate it in his professional life by being aware of his patients’ spiritual needs.
education: Medical SchoolIndiana University School of Medicine

title: Brooke Bellman APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Brooke Bellman APRN CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Brooke Bellman, CNM is a board-certified nurse-midwife.Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.Care philosophy: Brooke's care philosophy is centered on helping women make the best decisions regarding their health and well-being in a holistic fashion. She enjoys caring for women from all backgrounds of life.More about me: Brooke has spend the majority of her nursing career in the Toledo-area, caring for women and girls of multiple generations in the community. Brooke feels fortunate to have been involved with the care of many her family, friends and co-workers who have babies. She has a reputation as the 'baby whisperer' when it comes to rocking a baby to sleep. Brooke enjoys people and feels it is special to have the privilege to care for multiple generations by referral.

title: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Tracy L. Bartson, APRN, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.Philosophy of care: To hone into the individual needs of each woman while encouraging autonomy by being active participants in their care plan.  Tracy's goal is to empower women with up-to-date education and evidenced-based practice while instilling confidence in their ability to achieve healthy outcomes. She assures respect and privacy while promoting involvement of significant others per patient consent.Clinical interests: Education to adolescents and young adults on the variety of norms of the female reproductive system and sexual health. For pregnant and laboring patients, education on the impact of daily exercise and Spinning Babies techniques in regards to maintaining comfort and healthy outcomes. Additionally, helping women navigate the challenges of menopause with safe appropriate use of hormone replacement therapy and adjunct medication.More about me: Tracy enjoys nature. It keeps her grounded to be outdoors hiking, camping, backpacking, kayaking and gardening. Tracy's outlook is that inclement weather should not hold her back. Maintaining a calm, positive attitude in harsh conditions keeps her prepared for challenges in other areas of life.
education: Associates in NursingUniversity of Toledo ComTech

title: Ellen Baxter DO - Ear, Nose and Throat (Otolaryngology) - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

View Location Details
content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.



Dr. Baxter is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is a Fellow with the American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. 



Special procedures that Dr. Baxter performs include: Hyoid suspension for sleep apnea, snoring injection procedure, sialoendoscopy, eustachian tuboplasty, cosmetic and functional rhinoplasty, otoplasty.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine

title: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM - Midwifery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Tracy L Bartson APRN, CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Tracy L. Bartson, APRN, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.Philosophy of care: To hone into the individual needs of each woman while encouraging autonomy by being active participants in their care plan.  Tracy's goal is to empower women with up-to-date education and evidenced-based practice while instilling confidence in their ability to achieve healthy outcomes. She assures respect and privacy while promoting involvement of significant others per patient consent.Clinical interests: Education to adolescents and young adults on the variety of norms of the female reproductive system and sexual health. For pregnant and laboring patients, education on the impact of daily exercise and Spinning Babies techniques in regards to maintaining comfort and healthy outcomes. Additionally, helping women navigate the challenges of menopause with safe appropriate use of hormone replacement therapy and adjunct medication.More about me: Tracy enjoys nature. It keeps her grounded to be outdoors hiking, camping, backpacking, kayaking and gardening. Tracy's outlook is that inclement weather should not hold her back. Maintaining a calm, positive attitude in harsh conditions keeps her prepared for challenges in other areas of life.
education: Associates in NursingUniversity of Toledo ComTech

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.



Dr. Baxter is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is a Fellow with the American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology- Head and Neck Surgery, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy. 



Special procedures that Dr. Baxter performs include: Hyoid suspension for sleep apnea, snoring injection procedure, sialoendoscopy, eustachian tuboplasty, cosmetic and functional rhinoplasty, otoplasty.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine

title: Meghan Beck PA-C - Orthopaedic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Meghan Beck PA-C
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedics l Trauma and Adult Reconstruction
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Orthopaedics l Trauma and Adult Reconstruction

content.biography: Meghan Beck, PA-C is an orthopedic physician assistant that has been working in the acute orthopededic trauma setting since 2010. She manages orthopedic trauma inpatients and outpatients both independently and in collaboration with our orthopedic trauma attendings. Meghan is also first assist in the operating room. She also treats patients for primary and secondary fracture prevention in a bone health program.Meghan's philosophy of care involves providing evidence based, best practice care while also treating patients as she would want to be treated. She obtained her Bachelor’s degree from the University of Dayton while also being a member of their division 1 women’s soccer program. Meghan returned to Toledo to obtain her Master’s degree at the University of Toledo in their physician assistant program. She completed a fracture liaison certificate through the national osteoporosis foundation. In 2018, Meghan was awarded a risk management grant to create a fracture liaison service at ProMedica to improve the quality of fracture prevention care for patients that have sustained a fragility fracture. She also helped create a secondary fracture prevention program to help manage patients who are at increased risk for additional fracturesMeghan grew up in Toledo and returned to raise her family and provide orthopedic care to her community.

content.biography: Karl Beer, MD provides comprehensive care for patients with arthritis of the hip or knee including evaluation, x-rays, injections as well as surgical repair. He treats arthritic hips and knees with conservative measures (medication, therapy, injections) until the patient reaches end stage disease causing disabling pain and loss of function of involved joint. Dr. Beer participated in advanced training to learn the Anterior Total Hip procedure at age 55 and is certified in the Oxford Partial Knee Advanced instructional courseHe states that his spiritual life is very important to him and he tries to incorporate it in his professional life by being aware of his patients’ spiritual needs.
education: Medical SchoolIndiana University School of Medicine

content.biography: Brooke Bellman, CNM is a board-certified nurse-midwife.Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.Care philosophy: Brooke's care philosophy is centered on helping women make the best decisions regarding their health and well-being in a holistic fashion. She enjoys caring for women from all backgrounds of life.More about me: Brooke has spend the majority of her nursing career in the Toledo-area, caring for women and girls of multiple generations in the community. Brooke feels fortunate to have been involved with the care of many her family, friends and co-workers who have babies. She has a reputation as the 'baby whisperer' when it comes to rocking a baby to sleep. Brooke enjoys people and feels it is special to have the privilege to care for multiple generations by referral.

content.name: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Zachary Chamberlin, PA-C, is a board-certified physician assistant who specializes in cardiothoracic surgery. Cardiothoracic surgery focuses on surgical problems related to the heart and chest cavity.

Conditions treated: Aortic valve disease, mitral valve disease, coronary artery disease, aortic dissections, lung cancer, and pneumothorax and infection.

Procedures/treatments performed: Minimally invasive procedures, endoscopic vein harvesting, pacemaker and lead extractions.Clinical interests: Cardiology and surgery.

More about me: Zachary graduated with his degree from Alderson Broaddus University in 2016 and was inducted into the Pi Alpha Honor Society upon graduation.Throughout his early life, he was always fascinated with the cardiac system and how it could be impacted by numerous variables that ultimately impact every other organ system in a person's body.
education: Master of Physician Assistant StudiesAlderson Broaddus University
Bachelor of Science in Exercise ScienceUniversity of Toledo

title: Brooke Cheney CNM - Midwifery - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Brooke Cheney CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Brooke Cheney, CNM, is a board-certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.
Care philosophy: Brooke strives to provide holistic, high quality, safe and evidence based healthcare to people from onset of puberty and throughout their lifespan. Her primary goal is to develop therapeutic relationships to support and empower patients and their families in achieving their optimal health goals.
Clinical interests: Physiologic birth, breastfeeding support and global women’s healthcare.
More about me: Part of Brooke's midwifery training was spent working with women, children and families in Uganda, Africa in a local community hospital. In her free time, she enjoys exploring the outdoors, trying new recipes and spending time with her family.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingMichigan State University
Master of Science in Nursing, MidwiferyUniversity of Michigan
Bachelor of Science in BiologyMichigan State University

content.biography: Valerie Castillo, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in family medicine who provides care to patients 12 years and older. Valerie started her career in 1991 as a State Tested Nursing Aid in long term care. She advanced her nursing studies to include a Licensed Practical Nursing in 1994, Registerd Nursing in 2001, bachelor's in nursing in 2010 and master's in nursing with a focus on family nurse practitioner in 2016. Her care philosophy is patient specific centered care. Valerie believes not one individual is identical and that every patient has different healthcare needs encompassed around his or her belief system. Valerie resides in Clyde and is known for having Savannah cats. When not working, she enjoys gardening and landscaping.

title: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Zachary Chamberlin PA-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Zachary Chamberlin, PA-C, is a board-certified physician assistant who specializes in cardiothoracic surgery. Cardiothoracic surgery focuses on surgical problems related to the heart and chest cavity.

Conditions treated: Aortic valve disease, mitral valve disease, coronary artery disease, aortic dissections, lung cancer, and pneumothorax and infection.

Procedures/treatments performed: Minimally invasive procedures, endoscopic vein harvesting, pacemaker and lead extractions.Clinical interests: Cardiology and surgery.

More about me: Zachary graduated with his degree from Alderson Broaddus University in 2016 and was inducted into the Pi Alpha Honor Society upon graduation.Throughout his early life, he was always fascinated with the cardiac system and how it could be impacted by numerous variables that ultimately impact every other organ system in a person's body.
education: Master of Physician Assistant StudiesAlderson Broaddus University
Bachelor of Science in Exercise ScienceUniversity of Toledo

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
Dr. Charnesky is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is an Associate Professor at the Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine and the University of Toledo. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic Association, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy.



Special procedures that Dr. Charnesky performs include: In-office Balloon Sinuplast and Earwells (newborn correction of auricle/ear malformations).
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine

content.biography:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.
Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica
Dr. Charnesky is a board certified physician with the American Osteopathic Board of Ophthalmology & Otolaryngology-Head & Neck Surgery. She is an Associate Professor at the Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine and the University of Toledo. She holds active memberships with the following professional societies: American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic College of Ophthalmology and Otolaryngology Head & Neck Surgery, American Osteopathic Association, and American Academy of Otolaryngic Allergy.



Special procedures that Dr. Charnesky performs include: In-office Balloon Sinuplast and Earwells (newborn correction of auricle/ear malformations).
education: Medical SchoolMichigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine

title: Brooke Cheney CNM - Midwifery - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Brooke Cheney CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Brooke Cheney, CNM, is a board-certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.
Care philosophy: Brooke strives to provide holistic, high quality, safe and evidence based healthcare to people from onset of puberty and throughout their lifespan. Her primary goal is to develop therapeutic relationships to support and empower patients and their families in achieving their optimal health goals.
Clinical interests: Physiologic birth, breastfeeding support and global women’s healthcare.
More about me: Part of Brooke's midwifery training was spent working with women, children and families in Uganda, Africa in a local community hospital. In her free time, she enjoys exploring the outdoors, trying new recipes and spending time with her family.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingMichigan State University
Master of Science in Nursing, MidwiferyUniversity of Michigan
Bachelor of Science in BiologyMichigan State University

title: Madeleine Craig MD, MBA - Obstetrics - Perrysburg, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Madeleine Craig MD, MBA
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons

content.biography:
Madeleine Craig, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist. Obstetrics is the field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period, after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women’s health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists can also help diagnose cervical, uterine, and ovarian cancer. They treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate and counsel on contraception.

Care philosophy: Dr. Craig’s care philosophy is centered around listening and collaboration. She believes in listening to her patients’ biggest questions and concerns, reviewing the most up-to-date and pertinent treatment options a patient may have, and deciding upon a plan together.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancies, painful or irregular menstrual periods. Contraception, fibroids, sexual health, menopause, routine screening

Procedures performed: Minimally invasive (robotic) surgery, including hysterectomy, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy) or ovaries (oophorectomy); endometrial ablation, hysteroscopy

More about me: Dr. Craig grew up all over the country, but found her home in Northwest Ohio with her husband and two golden retrievers. In her spare time, you’ll find her enjoying the great food Toledo has to offer, watching a Wolverine or Green Bay football game, or cooking a new recipe.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
ResidencyOBGYN, University of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI
Master of Business AdministrationUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio

title: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Kevin Creedon, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in acute care that specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Kevin is certified through the American Association of Critical Care Nurses and the Ohio Board of Nursing (for both my RN and APRN). He also has his ACLS and BLS through the American Heart Association.

Care philosophy: His goal is to care for patients to his utmost ability with a compassionate mindset to provide the most appropriate and timely care. Kevin also believes in treating patients like he would treat his family. He is a relaxed individual that will not judge based on prior life choices or circumstances and will provide clinically appropriate care.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia, cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, and dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Kevin was an ICU nurse for roughly seven years before becoming a nurse practitioner and has only been a nurse practitioner in cardiology. In addition to cardiology, he is also interested in nephrology and pulmonary.

He is from Pittsburgh, PA and enjoys sports (football, baseball, lacrosse, and hockey), especially his hometown teams.

title: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. Donald Crescenzo is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. He is also a board-certified medical examiner. He treats a full range of cardiac issues. He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.
Dr. Crescenzo is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.
education: Medical SchoolGeorgetown University School of Medicine

title: ProMedica Physicians | Gynecology Oncology

content.name: Aleia Crim MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies
content.biography:
Care philosophy: Dr. Crim thinks it is important to address patients’ needs with a team approach to care. With her support team and her patient’s support team working together towards a common discussed goal, we can provide excellent care and achieve amazing outcomes. It is important that the patient’s goals are always addressed and are the center of the physician/patient determined care plan.
Dr. Crim is a native of Birmingham, Alabama and fell in love with Ohio during training. She and her family are actually looking forward to true winter weather again. Dr. Crim finds humor to be an important part of forming patient relationships since laughter is the best medicine. She is a passionate advocate of women’s health care and hopes to make a difference for the women in northwest Ohio and the surrounding areas.
For full disclosure purposes, she likes her patients and families to be aware that she is a huge University of Alabama fan. Roll tide!
Special interests: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers. Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies. Complex gynecologic/pelvic surgery. Particular interest in minimally invasive surgical techniques including laparoscopic and robotic approaches where appropriate. Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials.
Conditions treated: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers.
Procedures performed: Robotic, laparoscopic, vaginal, and open approaches to complex pelvic surgery. Radical cytoreductive surgery in the management of gynecologic malignancies.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Alabama, Tuscaloosa, Alabama
ResidencyOhio State University Medical Center, Columbus, Ohio
FellowshipOklahoma University Health Sciences Center, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
Board CertificationBoard eligible in Gynecologic Oncology and Obstetrics/Gynecology
University of Toledo AppointmentClinical Assistant Professor, Department of Surgery and Associate Program Director, General Surgery Residency

content.biography: Kevin Dankert, DO is a physical medicine and rehabilitation/sports medicine physician focusing on acute or chronic medical conditions affecting the spine, muscles, joints, and nerves. He takes a holistic approach in addressing both the pain and function in relation to these conditions. Dr. Dankert has a strong interest in interventional treatments including precise image guided injections using fluoroscopy or ultrasound and using regenerative medicine options such as platelets are stem cells in addition to the more traditional treatment options.Dr. Dankert was born and raised in Toledo and currently provides sports medicine coverage for the University Of Toledo Men's basketball team as well as coverage for Anthony Wayne High School.

Dr. Crim is a native of Birmingham, Alabama and fell in love with Ohio during training. She and her family are actually looking forward to true winter weather again. Dr. Crim finds humor to be an important part of forming patient relationships since laughter is the best medicine. She is a passionate advocate of women’s health care and hopes to make a difference for the women in northwest Ohio and the surrounding areas.
For full disclosure purposes, she likes her patients and families to be aware that she is a huge University of Alabama fan. Roll tide!
Special interests: Gynecologic malignancies including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar cancers. Risk reduction of hereditary gynecologic malignancies. Complex gynecologic/pelvic surgery. Particular interest in minimally invasive surgical techniques including laparoscopic and robotic approaches where appropriate. Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials.

title: Madeleine Craig MD, MBA - Obstetrics - Perrysburg, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Madeleine Craig MD, MBA
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons

content.biography:
Madeleine Craig, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist. Obstetrics is the field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period, after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women’s health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists can also help diagnose cervical, uterine, and ovarian cancer. They treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate and counsel on contraception.

Care philosophy: Dr. Craig’s care philosophy is centered around listening and collaboration. She believes in listening to her patients’ biggest questions and concerns, reviewing the most up-to-date and pertinent treatment options a patient may have, and deciding upon a plan together.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancies, painful or irregular menstrual periods. Contraception, fibroids, sexual health, menopause, routine screening

Procedures performed: Minimally invasive (robotic) surgery, including hysterectomy, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy) or ovaries (oophorectomy); endometrial ablation, hysteroscopy

More about me: Dr. Craig grew up all over the country, but found her home in Northwest Ohio with her husband and two golden retrievers. In her spare time, you’ll find her enjoying the great food Toledo has to offer, watching a Wolverine or Green Bay football game, or cooking a new recipe.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
ResidencyOBGYN, University of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI
Master of Business AdministrationUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio

title: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Kevin Creedon APRN-CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Kevin Creedon, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner in acute care that specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Kevin is certified through the American Association of Critical Care Nurses and the Ohio Board of Nursing (for both my RN and APRN). He also has his ACLS and BLS through the American Heart Association.

Care philosophy: His goal is to care for patients to his utmost ability with a compassionate mindset to provide the most appropriate and timely care. Kevin also believes in treating patients like he would treat his family. He is a relaxed individual that will not judge based on prior life choices or circumstances and will provide clinically appropriate care.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia, cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, and dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Kevin was an ICU nurse for roughly seven years before becoming a nurse practitioner and has only been a nurse practitioner in cardiology. In addition to cardiology, he is also interested in nephrology and pulmonary.

He is from Pittsburgh, PA and enjoys sports (football, baseball, lacrosse, and hockey), especially his hometown teams.

title: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA - Cardiothoracic Surgery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Donald G Crescenzo MD, MBA
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. Donald Crescenzo is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. He is also a board-certified medical examiner. He treats a full range of cardiac issues. He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.
Dr. Crescenzo is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.
education: Medical SchoolGeorgetown University School of Medicine

title: Robert Drenchko DO - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Robert Drenchko DO
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Robert Drenchko, DO is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: While attending the University of Michigan, Dr. Drenchko rowed varsity crew. Being a student-athlete for four years largely inspired his philosophy of a team approach to healthcare. The patient is always the team leader and he serves to be a promotional aspect of her healthcare journey.
More about me: Dr. Drenchko was raised in Shelby Township, Michigan. His father was an OB/GYN and his mother was a figure skating instructor. When he is not practicing medicine, he enjoys staying active; training at a gym or being outdoors. He loves to spend time with his family and friends. He's also a car and motorcycle enthusiast and can often be found riding his motorcycle at local raceways.
A huge passion of Dr. Drenchko's is education. He is always working to educate himself through evidence-based literature and presentations. He is part of ProMedica's quality committee because providing exceptional evidenced based care is very important to him. He works hard to educate his patients so they can make informed decisions about their care. He also always looks forward to educating resident physicians and medical students. Dr. Drenchko is grateful and excited to be part of the new wave in promoting and optimizing women’s health care.
education: Medical SchoolLake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, Erie, PA
ResidencyThe University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich.

His goal is to fully support his patients in their journey to self-betterment.

title: Robert Drenchko DO - Obstetrics - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Robert Drenchko DO
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Robert Drenchko, DO is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: While attending the University of Michigan, Dr. Drenchko rowed varsity crew. Being a student-athlete for four years largely inspired his philosophy of a team approach to healthcare. The patient is always the team leader and he serves to be a promotional aspect of her healthcare journey.
More about me: Dr. Drenchko was raised in Shelby Township, Michigan. His father was an OB/GYN and his mother was a figure skating instructor. When he is not practicing medicine, he enjoys staying active; training at a gym or being outdoors. He loves to spend time with his family and friends. He's also a car and motorcycle enthusiast and can often be found riding his motorcycle at local raceways.
A huge passion of Dr. Drenchko's is education. He is always working to educate himself through evidence-based literature and presentations. He is part of ProMedica's quality committee because providing exceptional evidenced based care is very important to him. He works hard to educate his patients so they can make informed decisions about their care. He also always looks forward to educating resident physicians and medical students. Dr. Drenchko is grateful and excited to be part of the new wave in promoting and optimizing women’s health care.
education: Medical SchoolLake Erie College of Osteopathic Medicine, Erie, PA
ResidencyThe University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences, Toledo, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich.

title: ProMedica Physicians Behavioral Health Lenawee

content.name: Nigel Dsouza MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Care Philosophy
Nigel Dsouza, MD, feels it is an honor and a privilege to be a psychiatrist. He believes in establishing a highly supportive environment where people in distress can be openly addressed in a collaborative fashion. Since all patients have unique backgrounds and life experiences, Dr. Dsouza emphasizes building trust, so that each patient feels comfortable in sharing their needs. His goal is to fully support his patients in their journey to self-betterment.
education: Medical SchoolAtlantic University School of Medicine, St. Lucia
Residency:  General PsychiatryEast Tennessee State University, Johnson City, Tennessee

content.biography:
As a member of the trauma team, I perform rapid assessment, stabilization and intervention for victims of a wide variety of injuries. Our team and colleagues are equipped to provide immediate high-level care for patients with nearly any type of injury. Providing an opportunity for severely injured patients to survive and recover from devastating injuries is very rewarding.
I am also grateful that I have had the opportunity to share the skills and knowledge I have gained over my twenty years of experience in trauma and general surgery with many students and residents.

title: ProMedica Physicians Behavioral Health Lenawee

content.name: Tanya Faulhaber LMSW
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Tanya Faulhaber, LMSW, graduated with an undergraduate degree from Adrian College and earned her master’s degree in social work from Eastern Michigan University. She began in the social work field in 2012 and has clinical experience working with children, families, and individuals. Previously she worked with families and children in office, school-based, and home-based settings providing therapy and crisis intervention needs. Tanya’s areas of specialty are helping adolescents and teens heal from traumatic events in their lives.

She has a certification in Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (TF-CBT) to provide trauma therapy to children. Tanya’s therapeutic approach is centered on creating a space that allows for healing, self-worth, and gaining skills to help clients achieve their goals and increase their quality of life.
education: Graduate EducationEastern Michigan University, Ypsilanti, Michigan

content.biography:
Ashley Fernando, DPM, was born and raised in Canada. She graduated from the University of Manitoba and eared her medical degree from Dr. William M. Scholl College of Podiatric Medicine in Illinois. Dr. Fernando completed her surgical training at Mercy St. Vincent Medical Center in Toledo, Ohio. She is board certified by the American Board of Podiatric Medicine and board qualified by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery.
Dr. Fernando is a certified yoga instructor through Yoga Alliance and a certified meditation instructor through the Chopra Center. She believes in providing exceptional foot and ankle preventative and conservative care before proceeding with surgical intervention. She has a special interest in minimally invasive surgery and severe limb infections.
education: Doctor of Podiatric MedicineRosalind Franklin University of Medicine and Science

content.biography:
Ashley Fernando, DPM, was born and raised in Canada. She graduated from the University of Manitoba and eared her medical degree from Dr. William M. Scholl College of Podiatric Medicine in Illinois. Dr. Fernando completed her surgical training at Mercy St. Vincent Medical Center in Toledo, Ohio. She is board certified by the American Board of Podiatric Medicine and board qualified by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery.
Dr. Fernando is a certified yoga instructor through Yoga Alliance and a certified meditation instructor through the Chopra Center. She believes in providing exceptional foot and ankle preventative and conservative care before proceeding with surgical intervention. She has a special interest in minimally invasive surgery and severe limb infections.
education: Doctor of Podiatric MedicineRosalind Franklin University of Medicine and Science

title: ProMedica Physicians Gynecology Oncology

content.name: Anjalika Gandhi MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Gynecologic Malignancies (including ovarian, uterine, cervical, and vulvar)
Management of chemotherapeutic treatment for gynecologic malignancies, including consideration for personalized genomic targeted therapy and evaluation for clinical trials
content.biography:
Dr. Gandhi is a fellowship-trained gynecologic oncologist who treats all patients with cancers of the female reproductive tract. Her approach is to manage her whole patient, not just their cancer. She sees cancer care as a journey and wishes to be your guide and partner at every step, from meticulous surgical intervention and targeted chemotherapy or radiation to clinical trials, treatment breaks, survivorship, and/or palliative care. Your goals, support systems, resources, and identities are unique, and navigating each of these is part of a tailoring your comprehensive cancer care plan. Our extensive healthcare team will use all the tools at our disposal to achieve the best outcome for you.

A native of the Chicagoland area, Dr. Gandhi has completed her training in different parts of the country, including Pennsylvania, Ohio, Florida, and Oklahoma. This has allowed her to engage with patients of various backgrounds and belief systems and customize her clinical approach. As a woman of South Asian descent with strong family ties, she understands how ethnicity and culture can influence relationships with the healthcare system. She remains connected to her cultural heritage through Indian performing arts.

Special interests: Diversity, equity, and inclusion in healthcare; fertility-sparing surgery, targeted therapeutics, clinical trial recruitment, palliative care.
education: Medical SchoolCleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio
Bachelor of ArtsUniversity of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Bachelor of ScienceUniversity of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania
Residency: Obstetrics and GynecologyUniversity of South Florida and Tampa General Hospital, Tampa, Florida
Fellowship: Gynecologic OncologyUniversity of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
Masters of Science, Clinical ResearchCleveland Clinic Lerner College of Medicine of Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio
Residency Brunschwig Gynecologic Oncology RotationMemorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, New York, New York

title: Susan Garrity MA, BCBA, COBA, LBA - Applied Behavioral Analysis, Autism Spectrum Disorder - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.imgAlt: Susan Garrity MA, BCBA, COBA, LBA
content.name: Susan Garrity MA, BCBA, COBA, LBA
content.services: Applied Behavioral Analysis, Autism Spectrum Disorder
content.location: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.biography: Susan has been with the ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center since October 2021. She has been in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis since 2015, beginning as a 1:1 behavior technician. She has a Bachelor of Arts in psychology and a Master of Arts in special education. She became a Board Certified Behavior Analyst, Certified Ohio Behavior Analyst, and Licensed Behavior Analyst (Michigan) in 2020. Before that, Susan spent many years working with students of all ages teaching 1:1 and in small groups. Susan loves to see children and adults gain skills and understanding of new topics. In her free time, Susan spends time with her husband, five adult children, and four former foster children. She also enjoys outdoor activities and exercise.

title: ProMedica Physicians Hematology Oncology Associates

content.name: Nichole Garza MSN, APRN CNP-BC
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Hematology oncology is a medical specialty which entails the diagnosis and treatment of both benign and malignant blood disorders and malignant cancers.

Nichole Garza, APRN, CNP-C is a hematology oncology nurse practitioner. She thrives to provide comprehensive care for hematology and medical oncology patients in collaboration with board-certified physicians. Nichole is passionate about early recognition, diagnosis, treatment, symptom management, and individualized patient-centered care.

content.biography: Susan has been with the ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center since October 2021. She has been in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis since 2015, beginning as a 1:1 behavior technician. She has a Bachelor of Arts in psychology and a Master of Arts in special education. She became a Board Certified Behavior Analyst, Certified Ohio Behavior Analyst, and Licensed Behavior Analyst (Michigan) in 2020. Before that, Susan spent many years working with students of all ages teaching 1:1 and in small groups. Susan loves to see children and adults gain skills and understanding of new topics. In her free time, Susan spends time with her husband, five adult children, and four former foster children. She also enjoys outdoor activities and exercise.

title: Patricia Graffice FNP-C - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Patricia Graffice FNP-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Patricia Graffice, FNP-C is an advanced practice provider for cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.
Patricia started with her family nurse practitioner certification in 2008 before there were a lot of subspecialty nurse practitioner options. She then decided to further her formal education and obtained her adult geriatric acute care post-master’s certification in 2019, with board certification in 2020.

Care philosophy: Her goal is to treat patients as she would her own family and educate them, so they understand their health and have a better quality of life.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias (atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia), cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Patricia has been passionate about cardiology for more than 20 years. Half of which she spent practicing as a nurse practitioner. The other half as a cardiac stepdown/ICU nurse.
Her interest in cardiology started when she was 14 years old. That's when her cousin died at age 6 after her third open heart surgery. Her interested deepened when she did her nursing clinicals at Medical College of Ohio (MCO) on the cardiac stepdown floor.

title: Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS - Physical Therapy - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Safe Return to Exercise Post Partum
content.biography:
More About Me
Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS is an orthopedic and pelvic health physical therapist who has a passion for helping women return to normal function and their favorite physical activities. She is a board certified Orthopedic Clinical Specialist by the ABPTS. As a young mom herself, she especially enjoys and easily relates to patients in the early post-partum period. Sarah is an exercise enthusiast, has trained for triathlons and has a passion for nutrition and all things food. In her spare time, you will find her in the kitchen or spending time with her husband and two active little boys.
Care philosophy
I believe in a holistic approach to treatment; that the mind and body are strongly connected and must be treated concurrently for the best outcomes. I focus heavily on education with patients to help them understand how their bodies work, what their current impairments are and how to take ownership and control back into their own hands. My early career was heavily sports and orthopedic based, so now I combine my passion for an active lifestyle with women's health to help women return to the activities they love. It is important for the patient and provider to have a great teamwork relationship. My goal is to help patients achieve their goals, whether that is returning to daily activities, being active or even running a marathon!
Conditions Treated
Pelvic pain, perinatal and postpartum pain/dysfunction, diastasis recti, adolescent pelvic dysfunction and pain, urinary/fecal incontinence, myofascial pain, low back and hip pain, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, somatic pelvic dysfunction
Procedures Performed
Pelvic floor physical therapy, manual therapy techniques, myofascial release, kinesiotaping, soft tissue mobilization, gait and running analysis. Patient education regarding fluid management, bladder and bowel education.

title: Michael Grillis DO, FACOS - General Surgery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Michael Grillis DO, FACOS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Michael Grillis, DO, FACOS, is a board-certified general surgeon. General surgery is a surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts.

Care philosophy: Dr. Grillis believes in treating patients the way he would want himself or his family members to be treated.

Conditions treated: Biliary disease, colon cancer, diseases of the small bowel, gastroesophageal reflux, and hernias.

Procedures performed: Breast cancer operations, endoscopy, minimally invasive surgery, and robotic surgery.

More about me: Dr. Grillis is a Fellow of the American College of Osteopathic Surgeons. He enjoys teaching medical students along with interns and residents.

On a personal note, he likes to spend his spare time exercising, biking, being outdoors and traveling. He also enjoys spending time with his family and friends.
education: Medical SchoolWest Virginia School of Osteopathic Medicine

title: Patricia Graffice FNP-C - Cardiology - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Patricia Graffice FNP-C
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Patricia Graffice, FNP-C is an advanced practice provider for cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.
Patricia started with her family nurse practitioner certification in 2008 before there were a lot of subspecialty nurse practitioner options. She then decided to further her formal education and obtained her adult geriatric acute care post-master’s certification in 2019, with board certification in 2020.

Care philosophy: Her goal is to treat patients as she would her own family and educate them, so they understand their health and have a better quality of life.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, congested heart failure, arrhythmias (atrial fibrillation, SVT, bradycardia), cardiomyopathy/congestive heart failure, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, valvular heart disease, vascular primary prevention, pulmonary hypertension, dysautonomia/POTS.

More about me: Patricia has been passionate about cardiology for more than 20 years. Half of which she spent practicing as a nurse practitioner. The other half as a cardiac stepdown/ICU nurse.
Her interest in cardiology started when she was 14 years old. That's when her cousin died at age 6 after her third open heart surgery. Her interested deepened when she did her nursing clinicals at Medical College of Ohio (MCO) on the cardiac stepdown floor.

content.biography: Danielle Grieb, CNP been working for ProMedica for five years as a RN in Pediatrics before starting as a Pediatric Nurse Practitioner. Her passion has always been in pediatrics and providing the highest quality care that she can to children and their families. Danielle wants to continue to provide patients with individualized care and making sure they feel like they are being heard when they come into the office. Her goal is to keep patients and families involved in their care. Danielle enjoys taking on new patients and getting to know their families and is excited to watch her patients grow and develop through the many different stages of life. Danielle is a certified Pediatric Primary Care Nurse Practitioner in the state of Ohio and is also APHON certified in Chemotherapy and Biotherapy. Prior to working as a NP, she worked in Pediatric Hematology and Oncology where she used this certification. Danielle's goal is to continue to grow and learn from peers and to further her education in any way possible.

title: Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS - Physical Therapy - Sylvania, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
conditionsProcedures: Safe Return to Exercise Post Partum
content.biography:
More About Me
Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS is an orthopedic and pelvic health physical therapist who has a passion for helping women return to normal function and their favorite physical activities. She is a board certified Orthopedic Clinical Specialist by the ABPTS. As a young mom herself, she especially enjoys and easily relates to patients in the early post-partum period. Sarah is an exercise enthusiast, has trained for triathlons and has a passion for nutrition and all things food. In her spare time, you will find her in the kitchen or spending time with her husband and two active little boys.
Care philosophy
I believe in a holistic approach to treatment; that the mind and body are strongly connected and must be treated concurrently for the best outcomes. I focus heavily on education with patients to help them understand how their bodies work, what their current impairments are and how to take ownership and control back into their own hands. My early career was heavily sports and orthopedic based, so now I combine my passion for an active lifestyle with women's health to help women return to the activities they love. It is important for the patient and provider to have a great teamwork relationship. My goal is to help patients achieve their goals, whether that is returning to daily activities, being active or even running a marathon!
Conditions Treated
Pelvic pain, perinatal and postpartum pain/dysfunction, diastasis recti, adolescent pelvic dysfunction and pain, urinary/fecal incontinence, myofascial pain, low back and hip pain, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, somatic pelvic dysfunction
Procedures Performed
Pelvic floor physical therapy, manual therapy techniques, myofascial release, kinesiotaping, soft tissue mobilization, gait and running analysis. Patient education regarding fluid management, bladder and bowel education.

title: Michael Grillis DO, FACOS - General Surgery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Michael Grillis DO, FACOS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Michael Grillis, DO, FACOS, is a board-certified general surgeon. General surgery is a surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts.

Care philosophy: Dr. Grillis believes in treating patients the way he would want himself or his family members to be treated.

Conditions treated: Biliary disease, colon cancer, diseases of the small bowel, gastroesophageal reflux, and hernias.

Procedures performed: Breast cancer operations, endoscopy, minimally invasive surgery, and robotic surgery.

More about me: Dr. Grillis is a Fellow of the American College of Osteopathic Surgeons. He enjoys teaching medical students along with interns and residents.

On a personal note, he likes to spend his spare time exercising, biking, being outdoors and traveling. He also enjoys spending time with his family and friends.
education: Medical SchoolWest Virginia School of Osteopathic Medicine

content.biography:
Imad Hariri, MD, FACC is a cardiologist who specializes in the care of patients with advanced congestive heart failure and cardiomyopathies, or conditions that affect the function of the heart muscle.

Dr. Hariri is board-certified cardiovascular diseases, advanced heart failure and transplant cardiology, internal medicine, nuclear cardiology, and echocardiography.

Care philosophy: He believes that every patient deserves top-notch, quality care that is unique to their specific health needs. He also believes that with the patient’s active participation and engagement, a team-based approach will improve how we take care of our patients.

Conditions treated: Congestive heart failure and advanced heart failure, cardiomyopathy, cardiogenic shock, left ventricular assist device (LVAD), mechanical circulatory support, cardiac sarcoidosis, and cardiac amyloidosis.

Procedures performed: Cardiac transplantation, right heart catheterization, endomyocardial biopsy, pulmonary artery sensor implantation, and invasive hemodynamic monitoring.

More about me: Dr. Hariri grew up in Toledo, Ohio, and graduated from Toledo Public Schools. He went to undergraduate school at the University of Toledo and is proud to take care of patients in the community he grew up in.
education: Medical SchoolRoss University School of Medicine
ResidencyUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine

content.name: David A Harper MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
David Harper, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
More about me: Dr. Harper works with high-risk obstetrical patients at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. He is also the medical director of the obstetrical unit at ProMedica Toledo Hospital and provides obstetrical stimulation of high risk emergencies to providers within ProMedica.
