content.biography:
Imad Hariri, MD, FACC is a cardiologist who specializes in the care of patients with advanced congestive heart failure and cardiomyopathies, or conditions that affect the function of the heart muscle.

Dr. Hariri is board-certified cardiovascular diseases, advanced heart failure and transplant cardiology, internal medicine, nuclear cardiology, and echocardiography.

Care philosophy: He believes that every patient deserves top-notch, quality care that is unique to their specific health needs. He also believes that with the patient’s active participation and engagement, a team-based approach will improve how we take care of our patients.

Conditions treated: Congestive heart failure and advanced heart failure, cardiomyopathy, cardiogenic shock, left ventricular assist device (LVAD), mechanical circulatory support, cardiac sarcoidosis, and cardiac amyloidosis.

Procedures performed: Cardiac transplantation, right heart catheterization, endomyocardial biopsy, pulmonary artery sensor implantation, and invasive hemodynamic monitoring.

More about me: Dr. Hariri grew up in Toledo, Ohio, and graduated from Toledo Public Schools. He went to undergraduate school at the University of Toledo and is proud to take care of patients in the community he grew up in.
education: Medical SchoolRoss University School of Medicine
ResidencyUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine
content.media: News Links February is American Heart Month

title: David A Harper MD - Obstetrics - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: David A Harper MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
David Harper, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
More about me: Dr. Harper works with high-risk obstetrical patients at ProMedica Toledo Hospital. He is also the medical director of the obstetrical unit at ProMedica Toledo Hospital and provides obstetrical stimulation of high risk emergencies to providers within ProMedica.
education: Medical SchoolThe University of Toledo Medical Center
ResidencyThe University of Toledo Medical Center

content.biography:
Jessica Hartle, FNP-BC, is a certified family nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Care philosophy: Jessica has a strong desire to help patients understand their risks for cardiovascular disease before being affected. She believes preventive medicine is key to reducing mortality risks, especially in patients with a strong family history for cardiovascular disease.

Conditions treated: Arrhythmias, coronary artery disease, heart failure, hypertension, and valvular disease.

More about me: Jessica chose to pursue a family practice certification to provide care for patients at any stage of their lives and to establish long-term relationships with them. Cardiology has always been a specific interest of hers.
education: Master of Science in NursingChamberlin University

content.biography: Mouhammad Jumaa, MD specializes in vascular neurology and interventional neurology. Vascular neurology is the specialized treatment of stroke and its risk factors. Interventional neurology relies on advanced imaging and minimally invasive surgical techniques to treat serious neurological conditions such as brain aneurysms, brain bleed, stroke, and vascular disease.

content.biography:
Omar Kahaly, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Kahaly is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Conditions treated: Syncope, atrial fibrillation, pacemakers, cardiac arrhythmias, and defibrillators.

Procedures/treatments performed: Heart ablations, sudden cardiac arrest, palpitations, Watchman implantation, and pacemaker/defibrillator extraction.

More about me: Dr. Kahaly grew up in Toledo, Ohio and considers it his mission to help bring the best healthcare to the community that raised him. At ProMedica, he is active in cutting-edge clinical research.

content.biography:
Adil Karamali, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Karamali is board-certified in internal medicine and critical care.

Care philosophy: Dr. Karamali’s main goal is to keep a patient’s heart healthy. Above all, each patient must be treated as a family member with compassion and empathy. Words of wisdom from a mentor are still with him to this day: Patient First.

Clinical interests: More than the practice of general cardiology, he takes pride in his abilities as an interventional cardiologist. Additionally, Dr. Karamali has a keen interest in the care of oncology patients as it pertains to their cardiac risk secondary to their underlying malignancy.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, congestive heart failure, acute coronary syndrome, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, cardiac catheterization, transesophageal echocardiography, and cardioversion.

More about me: Dr. Karamali met his wife in college when he was a student at Boston College. She was the only one he dated there.

ProMedica Cardiothoracic Surgeon Dr. Michael Moront is a classmate of his from college.

Dr. Karamali was on the Olympic team for Pakistan for swimming, but he emigrated to the United States before he could compete. His father was in the 1948 Olympics for swimming for Pakistan.

He is an avid golfer, but is not sure what he does on the course can be called “golf”.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of the Caribbean

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
More about Gregory Kasper MD, FACS
Dr. Kasper has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In 2015, Dr. Kasper was named president and chief medical officer of Jobst Vascular Institute.
Dr. Kasper was born and raised in Toledo and returned after completing his medical training. Dr. Kasper and his wife, Christina, have three sons. Both Dr. and Mrs. Kasper are active in charitable work and enjoy travel and golfing.

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Kanios' goal is to treat each patient with care and respect to convey to them how much she love what she does. She's happy working with them, seeing them, and taking care of them over the course of a long period of time. 


Clinical interests: Robotics
Special certifications: Member of ABOG, NCC Certification, ACOG Fellow
education: Medical SchoolThe University of Toledo College of Medicine

content.biography:
Adil Karamali, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Karamali is board-certified in internal medicine and critical care.

Care philosophy: Dr. Karamali’s main goal is to keep a patient’s heart healthy. Above all, each patient must be treated as a family member with compassion and empathy. Words of wisdom from a mentor are still with him to this day: Patient First.

Clinical interests: More than the practice of general cardiology, he takes pride in his abilities as an interventional cardiologist. Additionally, Dr. Karamali has a keen interest in the care of oncology patients as it pertains to their cardiac risk secondary to their underlying malignancy.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, congestive heart failure, acute coronary syndrome, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, cardiac catheterization, transesophageal echocardiography, and cardioversion.

More about me: Dr. Karamali met his wife in college when he was a student at Boston College. She was the only one he dated there.

ProMedica Cardiothoracic Surgeon Dr. Michael Moront is a classmate of his from college.

Dr. Karamali was on the Olympic team for Pakistan for swimming, but he emigrated to the United States before he could compete. His father was in the 1948 Olympics for swimming for Pakistan.

He is an avid golfer, but is not sure what he does on the course can be called “golf”.
education: Medical SchoolAmerican University of the Caribbean

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renowned vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care.
More about Gregory Kasper MD, FACS
Dr. Kasper has been practicing vascular surgery in Toledo for more than 15 years. In 2015, Dr. Kasper was named president and chief medical officer of Jobst Vascular Institute.
Dr. Kasper was born and raised in Toledo and returned after completing his medical training. Dr. Kasper and his wife, Christina, have three sons. Both Dr. and Mrs. Kasper are active in charitable work and enjoy travel and golfing.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Cincinnati College of Medicine
FellowshipPeripheral Vascular Surgery Fellowship, Good Samaritan Hospital

content.biography: Stephanie Kastel, DPM, FACFAS, ABPM is board certified by the American Board of Podiatric Medicine and is board qualified in Foot Surgery and Reconstructive Rearfoot and Ankle Surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery. Dr. Kastel graduated from the Kent State University College of Podiatric Medicine. content.biography:
Victoria M. Kim, MD, is a board-certified surgeon and fellowship-trained surgical oncologist. Her professional interest is in complex abdominal and endocrine diseases, with a special interest in pancreatic cancer. Dr. Kim believes that patients with cancers and complex diseases deserve excellent care from a cohesive team of specialists across disciplines. This led her to pursue specialized fellowship training in surgical oncology at a high-volume center of excellence for cancer care. She is committed to doing her best for each patient she meets.
Dr. Kim's hobbies and personal interests include enjoying large bodies of water, reading, running, hiking, performance arts, dogs and perfecting Korean/Spanish language skills.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Hepatobiliary, Pancreatic and Endocrine Surgery

content.biography:
Victoria M. Kim, MD, is a board-certified surgeon and fellowship-trained surgical oncologist. Her professional interest is in complex abdominal and endocrine diseases, with a special interest in pancreatic cancer. Dr. Kim believes that patients with cancers and complex diseases deserve excellent care from a cohesive team of specialists across disciplines. This led her to pursue specialized fellowship training in surgical oncology at a high-volume center of excellence for cancer care. She is committed to doing her best for each patient she meets.
Dr. Kim's hobbies and personal interests include enjoying large bodies of water, reading, running, hiking, performance arts, dogs and perfecting Korean/Spanish language skills.
education: Medical SchoolDuke University School of Medicine, Durham, North Carolina
ResidencyGeneral Surgery, Johns Hopkins Hospital, Baltimore, Maryland

Fellowship: Surgical OncologyUniversity of Pittsburgh Medical Center, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

content.name: Emily King CNP
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Emily King, CNP, is a certified nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions. Conditions treated: Atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD), arrhythmias, cardiomyopathy, heart failure, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension. More about me: Emily was born at ProMedica Toledo Hospital and later returned to work in the Heart and Vascular Intensive Care Unit as a registered nurse. For seven years, she took care of open-heart surgery patients and patients with other cardiothoracic conditions.

In her downtime, she loves to spend time at Toledo’s Metroparks with her husband and two dogs.

content.biography:
Colleen Lavoy, PA-C, NCCPA, is a Physician Assistant in Maternal-Fetal Medicine. Maternal-fetal medicine is a medical specialty that focuses on the care of women with high-risk pregnancies or pregnancy complications. The health of the mother and the fetus are monitored closely during pregnancy.
Special interests: Diabetes, hypertension and preeclampsia, preterm birth, postpartum depression
More about me: Colleen feels very passionate about supporting women throughout their prenatal care and postpartum life thereafter. In her spare time, she enjoys being outside with her husband and two boys, running, biking and getting ice cream.

title: Xiaxi Layton MD - Family Medicine - Maumee, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Xiaxi Layton MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
660 Beaver Creek Circle
Suite 110
Maumee, OH 43537

content.biography:
Family medicine is a specialty that provides care to people of every age group. Xiaxi Layton, MD is very much a generalist, so family medicine was a great fit. I enjoy listening to my patient's stories, and getting to work with them on treatment options that would help them live their best lives. 
Having been trained in public health, Dr. Layton is an advocate in disease prevention and health education. She offers many preventative services from well child visits to a variety of cancer screenings. 
Dr. Layton was locally trained at UTMC, and completed residency at ProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency where she was awarded The Dana Roberts Founders Award upon graduation for emulating the caring and compassionate nature of family medicine. 
Dr. Layton would like her patients to know that she will always strive to be accessible. Whether it is struggling with smoking cessation or weight loss, she and her staff will be there to help and guide patients every step of the way.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine
ResidencyProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency Program

content.biography:
Jack Li, MD, MBA, FACC is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Li is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Philosophy of care: He believes in providing care that is centered around the patient. After each visit, his hope is that his patients fully understand their arrhythmic issues and through shared decision making, enact a plan of care personally tailored to their needs.

Conditions treated: Dr. Li specializes in the full range of care for heart rhythm issues and cardiac devices. He is experienced in complex arrhythmic management including ablations for atrial fibrillation, supraventricular tachycardias, and ventricular tachycardias. He also provides comprehensive management of implantable cardiac devices such as defibrillators, pacemakers, and cardiac resynchronization therapy.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac implantable device management. including pacemakers, defibrillators and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device, Watchman implantable device for left atrial appendage occlusion, lead management and extractions, familial arrhythmia syndromes including arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, Brugada syndrome, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and long QT syndrome, and postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome (POTS).

More about me: Dr. Li grew up in Iowa and loves to cheer on the University of Michigan - Go Blue! He is married to a wonderful partner who works as a pediatric nurse practitioner (she cheers for LSU) and is the father to a wonderful 6-year-old girl with one more on the way. He lives in Sylvania and enjoys attending county fairs, finding the best ice cream, and traveling.
education: Residency: Internal MedicineUniversity of Michigan Hospital System
Graduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ross School of Business

title: Rosie Li MD - Obstetrics - Perrysburg, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Rosie Li MD
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics | Gynecology - Levis Commons

content.biography:
Rosie Li, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Communication is at the center of Dr. Li's care philosophy. She believes that effective communication between the provider and the patient and the provider and other medical team specialties or team members is important for providing complete patient care. She wants the patient to feel like they had the opportunity to voice their concerns and ask all the questions. Additionally, she believes it is important to update all members who are involved in a particular patient's care to be on the same page to decrease miscommunication.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancy, menopause, abnormal menstrual bleeding, painful periods, contraception, endometriosis, fibroids, sexual health.

Procedures performed: Minimally-invasive hysterectomy, endometrial ablation, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy), removal of ovaries (oophorectomy), fibroid removal (myomectomy)More about me: Dr. Li grew up in three different countries and finally settled in Baltimore. She was drawn to the Midwest after attending University of Michigan and decided to come back for medical school after completing graduate school. She and her husband settled in Toledo, Ohio after completing her OB/GYN residency.
education: Medical SchoolWayne State University School of Medicine

content.biography:
Colleen Lavoy, PA-C, NCCPA, is a Physician Assistant in Maternal-Fetal Medicine. Maternal-fetal medicine is a medical specialty that focuses on the care of women with high-risk pregnancies or pregnancy complications. The health of the mother and the fetus are monitored closely during pregnancy.
Special interests: Diabetes, hypertension and preeclampsia, preterm birth, postpartum depression
More about me: Colleen feels very passionate about supporting women throughout their prenatal care and postpartum life thereafter. In her spare time, she enjoys being outside with her husband and two boys, running, biking and getting ice cream.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
660 Beaver Creek Circle
Suite 110

content.biography:
Family medicine is a specialty that provides care to people of every age group. Xiaxi Layton, MD is very much a generalist, so family medicine was a great fit. I enjoy listening to my patient's stories, and getting to work with them on treatment options that would help them live their best lives. 
Having been trained in public health, Dr. Layton is an advocate in disease prevention and health education. She offers many preventative services from well child visits to a variety of cancer screenings. 
Dr. Layton was locally trained at UTMC, and completed residency at ProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency where she was awarded The Dana Roberts Founders Award upon graduation for emulating the caring and compassionate nature of family medicine. 
Dr. Layton would like her patients to know that she will always strive to be accessible. Whether it is struggling with smoking cessation or weight loss, she and her staff will be there to help and guide patients every step of the way.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine
ResidencyProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency Program

content.biography:
Jack Li, MD, MBA, FACC is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Li is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Philosophy of care: He believes in providing care that is centered around the patient. After each visit, his hope is that his patients fully understand their arrhythmic issues and through shared decision making, enact a plan of care personally tailored to their needs.

Conditions treated: Dr. Li specializes in the full range of care for heart rhythm issues and cardiac devices. He is experienced in complex arrhythmic management including ablations for atrial fibrillation, supraventricular tachycardias, and ventricular tachycardias. He also provides comprehensive management of implantable cardiac devices such as defibrillators, pacemakers, and cardiac resynchronization therapy.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac implantable device management. including pacemakers, defibrillators and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device, Watchman implantable device for left atrial appendage occlusion, lead management and extractions, familial arrhythmia syndromes including arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, Brugada syndrome, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and long QT syndrome, and postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome (POTS).

More about me: Dr. Li grew up in Iowa and loves to cheer on the University of Michigan - Go Blue! He is married to a wonderful partner who works as a pediatric nurse practitioner (she cheers for LSU) and is the father to a wonderful 6-year-old girl with one more on the way. He lives in Sylvania and enjoys attending county fairs, finding the best ice cream, and traveling.
education: Residency: Internal MedicineUniversity of Michigan Hospital System
Graduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ross School of Business

content.biography:
Family medicine is a specialty that provides care to people of every age group. Xiaxi Layton, MD is very much a generalist, so family medicine was a great fit. I enjoy listening to my patient's stories, and getting to work with them on treatment options that would help them live their best lives. 
Having been trained in public health, Dr. Layton is an advocate in disease prevention and health education. She offers many preventative services from well child visits to a variety of cancer screenings. 
Dr. Layton was locally trained at UTMC, and completed residency at ProMedica Monroe Family Medicine Residency where she was awarded The Dana Roberts Founders Award upon graduation for emulating the caring and compassionate nature of family medicine. 
Dr. Layton would like her patients to know that she will always strive to be accessible. Whether it is struggling with smoking cessation or weight loss, she and her staff will be there to help and guide patients every step of the way.

content.biography:
Jack Li, MD, MBA, FACC is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that require pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Li is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Philosophy of care: He believes in providing care that is centered around the patient. After each visit, his hope is that his patients fully understand their arrhythmic issues and through shared decision making, enact a plan of care personally tailored to their needs.

Conditions treated: Dr. Li specializes in the full range of care for heart rhythm issues and cardiac devices. He is experienced in complex arrhythmic management including ablations for atrial fibrillation, supraventricular tachycardias, and ventricular tachycardias. He also provides comprehensive management of implantable cardiac devices such as defibrillators, pacemakers, and cardiac resynchronization therapy.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac implantable device management. including pacemakers, defibrillators and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) device, Watchman implantable device for left atrial appendage occlusion, lead management and extractions, familial arrhythmia syndromes including arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, Brugada syndrome, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and long QT syndrome, and postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome (POTS).

More about me: Dr. Li grew up in Iowa and loves to cheer on the University of Michigan - Go Blue! He is married to a wonderful partner who works as a pediatric nurse practitioner (she cheers for LSU) and is the father to a wonderful 6-year-old girl with one more on the way. He lives in Sylvania and enjoys attending county fairs, finding the best ice cream, and traveling.
education: Residency: Internal MedicineUniversity of Michigan Hospital System
Graduate EducationUniversity of Michigan, Ross School of Business

content.biography:
Rosie Li, MD is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Communication is at the center of Dr. Li's care philosophy. She believes that effective communication between the provider and the patient and the provider and other medical team specialties or team members is important for providing complete patient care. She wants the patient to feel like they had the opportunity to voice their concerns and ask all the questions. Additionally, she believes it is important to update all members who are involved in a particular patient's care to be on the same page to decrease miscommunication.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancy, menopause, abnormal menstrual bleeding, painful periods, contraception, endometriosis, fibroids, sexual health.

Procedures performed: Minimally-invasive hysterectomy, endometrial ablation, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy), removal of ovaries (oophorectomy), fibroid removal (myomectomy)More about me: Dr. Li grew up in three different countries and finally settled in Baltimore. She was drawn to the Midwest after attending University of Michigan and decided to come back for medical school after completing graduate school. She and her husband settled in Toledo, Ohio after completing her OB/GYN residency.

title: Alisha Marchand CNM - Midwifery - Oregon, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Alisha Marchand CNM
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Obstetrics and Gynecology - Oregon

content.biography:
Alisha Marchand, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Pregnancy is not a medical condition and should not be treated as such. Pregnancy, labor and delivery are all natural occurrences and it's important to listen to one's body. Alisha believes that medical interventions should be saved for when they are required. She is passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidence-based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.Clinical interests: Spinning babiesMore about me: Alisha has 13 years of experience in labor and delivery, providing support to patients and their families during labor. She believes in making decisions as a team and is supportive of any decisions that women and their family unit make prior to their arrival to labor and delivery. She believes that informed and supportive care is the only care and strives to make all patients and families feel comfortable. She also provides labor support training to staff nurses and other midwives to help decrease the rate of cesarean deliveries.

title: Bradley Marchese MD - Family Medicine - Tecumseh, Michigan (MI)

content.name: Bradley Marchese MD
content.location: ProMedica Physicians Health Specialists of Lenawee
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Physicians Health Specialists of Lenawee

content.biography:
Family Medicine provides care for the entire family from birth, throughout adulthood, and into the last stages of life. My care philosophy is centered around my clinical interests and what I believe are the core values of family medicine which is to practice preventative medicine and help patients make life-style changes to prevent disease. It is also about treating a wide spectrum of diseases and being the first line of contact for the healthcare system. In doing this effectively I hope to gain the trust and establish great relationships with my patients.

I grew up in Columbus, OH and went to The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences for my Master’s and Medical Degree. I then completed my residency at St. Joseph Mercy Livingston Family Medicine Residency where I was the Academic Chief Resident in my last year of residency before becoming certified by the American Board of Family Medicine.

Some interesting things that patients may not know about me would be that I have been skydiving before and I was a placekicker for John Carroll University in College. My interests include playing board games, riding bikes, personal finance, and spending time with family.

content.biography:
Alisha Marchand, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions.

Care philosophy: Pregnancy is not a medical condition and should not be treated as such. Pregnancy, labor and delivery are all natural occurrences and it's important to listen to one's body. Alisha believes that medical interventions should be saved for when they are required. She is passionate about treating patients holistically and providing evidence-based education and treatment techniques to ensure the best care.Clinical interests: Spinning babiesMore about me: Alisha has 13 years of experience in labor and delivery, providing support to patients and their families during labor. She believes in making decisions as a team and is supportive of any decisions that women and their family unit make prior to their arrival to labor and delivery. She believes that informed and supportive care is the only care and strives to make all patients and families feel comfortable. She also provides labor support training to staff nurses and other midwives to help decrease the rate of cesarean deliveries.

content.biography:
Family Medicine provides care for the entire family from birth, throughout adulthood, and into the last stages of life. My care philosophy is centered around my clinical interests and what I believe are the core values of family medicine which is to practice preventative medicine and help patients make life-style changes to prevent disease. It is also about treating a wide spectrum of diseases and being the first line of contact for the healthcare system. In doing this effectively I hope to gain the trust and establish great relationships with my patients.

I grew up in Columbus, OH and went to The University of Toledo College of Medicine and Life Sciences for my Master’s and Medical Degree. I then completed my residency at St. Joseph Mercy Livingston Family Medicine Residency where I was the Academic Chief Resident in my last year of residency before becoming certified by the American Board of Family Medicine.

Some interesting things that patients may not know about me would be that I have been skydiving before and I was a placekicker for John Carroll University in College. My interests include playing board games, riding bikes, personal finance, and spending time with family.

content.biography:
Darla Mitchell, CNM, is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions. 
As a midwife, Darla Mitchell provides care for women focusing on health, wellness, and prevention. Her goal is to use clinical expertise to empower women through health education and counseling. With this knowledge, they are able to become partners in their own care and to make personal choices which are best for themselves and their families.
She has special interests in adolescent health, lactation support and breast cancer survivorship and has been previously certified as a lactation consultant and as a childbirth educator. She has spent her entire nursing career involved in various aspects of maternal-child care; returning to graduate school to become a midwife once her own children were grown due to her passion for providing comprehensive and compassionate care for women in all stages of life.

content.biography: Arielle Moehling, PA-C believes in giving the best patient care possible. Her goal is to always have the patient leave with a smile on their face. She loves instilling positive energy into everyone she meets.Arielle is the oldest of her large family that includes 9 siblings.She is originally from Tiffin, Ohio and moved to the Toledo area in high school. Arielle wanted to explore what life was like outside of northwest Ohio and moved to Kettering, Ohio for her graduate school. She missed Toledo so much that she moved back and plans to build her life in Toledo with her fiance.

content.biography:
Dayna Mohammadione, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Mohammadione loves people and loves her profession. Her goal is to provide the best possible care to her patients.

content.biography:
Todd Monroe, MD, FACC specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions. According to Dr. Monroe, cardiology is an everchanging and a strong research-based specialty. Also that evidence based protocols largely dictate treatment and positive patient outcomes.

Dr. Monroe is board certified in internal medicine, cardiology, and interventional cardiology.

Care philosophy: He believes in appropriate aggressiveness and compassionate personalized care. He says his job is to listen to his patients and try to help them achieve optimal health.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, cardiogenic shock, congestive heart failure, and syncope.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac catheterization, intracoronary stent implantation, intracoronary rotablator and thrombectomy, intra-aortic balloon/ Impella life support, and temporary pacemaker insertion.

More about me: Dr. Monroe is interested in how stress and anxiety play a role in our overall physical health.

His personal interests include family time, scuba diving, golf, travel, trivia, and Kentucky Bourbon.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Kentucky College of Medicine
ResidencyUniversity of Kentucky College of Medicine
InternshipUniversity of Kentucky College of Medicine

content.name: Michael G Moront MD, FACS
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Dr. Michael Moront is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. He is also a board-certified medical examiner. He treats a full range of cardiac issues.

He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.Dr. Moront's care philosophy, in part, is unique care for every patient, with dedicated 'hands-on' care for all.He is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

content.biography:
Darla Mitchell, CNM, is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with fewer medical interventions. 
As a midwife, Darla Mitchell provides care for women focusing on health, wellness, and prevention. Her goal is to use clinical expertise to empower women through health education and counseling. With this knowledge, they are able to become partners in their own care and to make personal choices which are best for themselves and their families.
She has special interests in adolescent health, lactation support and breast cancer survivorship and has been previously certified as a lactation consultant and as a childbirth educator. She has spent her entire nursing career involved in various aspects of maternal-child care; returning to graduate school to become a midwife once her own children were grown due to her passion for providing comprehensive and compassionate care for women in all stages of life.

Dayna Mohammadione, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN).
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.
Care philosophy: Dr. Mohammadione loves people and loves her profession. Her goal is to provide the best possible care to her patients.

content.biography:
Todd Monroe, MD, FACC specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions. According to Dr. Monroe, cardiology is an everchanging and a strong research-based specialty. Also that evidence based protocols largely dictate treatment and positive patient outcomes.

Dr. Monroe is board certified in internal medicine, cardiology, and interventional cardiology.

Care philosophy: He believes in appropriate aggressiveness and compassionate personalized care. He says his job is to listen to his patients and try to help them achieve optimal health.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, cardiogenic shock, congestive heart failure, and syncope.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac catheterization, intracoronary stent implantation, intracoronary rotablator and thrombectomy, intra-aortic balloon/ Impella life support, and temporary pacemaker insertion.

More about me: Dr. Monroe is interested in how stress and anxiety play a role in our overall physical health.

His personal interests include family time, scuba diving, golf, travel, trivia, and Kentucky Bourbon.

ResidencyUniversity of Kentucky College of Medicine

hospitalAffiliations.hospitalName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.biography:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that persons individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Kelly appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so we may address your questions and educate you regarding the options of genetic testing. Kelly looks forward to talking with you.
education: Graduate EducationMaster's Degree | Medical Genetics | University of Cincinnati, Cincinnati, Ohio
Board CertificationGenetic Counseling | American Board of Genetic Counseling (Certifying Board and Agency)

content.imgAlt: Hind N Moussa MD MSHI, FACOG
content.name: Hind N Moussa MD MSHI, FACOG
content.location: Maternal-Fetal Medicine at ProMedica Toledo Hospital
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationName: Maternal-Fetal Medicine at ProMedica Toledo Hospital
primaryLocation.locationAddress:
2142 N. Cove Blvd.
1st Floor
Toledo, OH 43606

content.biography:
Hind Moussa MD, MSHI, FACOG specializes in maternal-fetal medicine. Maternal-fetal medicine is a medical specialty that focuses on the care of women with high-risk pregnancies or pregnancy complications. The health of the mother and the fetus are monitored closely during pregnancy. 
Care philosophy: As a maternal-fetal medicine specialist, Dr. Moussa believes that it is her honor and privilege to be there during some of the most exciting yet scariest moments a family may face. From her understanding of the journey those families go through stems her philosophy of the importance of being “present” for her patients during those times. She believes that her ability to be there and to provide support can have a long-lasting impact.
Clinical interests: Dr. Moussa's clinical interests include maternal medical complications during pregnancy, preterm birth and its prevention, as well as quality and safety improvement. On the fetal side, she is interested in fetal diagnosis and fetal neurodevelopment. During her fellowship training she focused her research on the fetal origins of autism etiology in relation to the maternal uterine environment, for which she received the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine excellence in research award. 
More about me: Dr. Moussa is family oriented and enjoys spending time with her daughter, and her niece and nephews. She is multilingual and fluent in Arabic, French and English. She enjoys community outreach both professionally and socially.
education: ResidencyInternal Medicine, American University of Beirut
ResidencyObstetrics and Gynecology, University of Cincinnati College of Medicine
FellowshipMaternal-Fetal Medicine, The University of Texas Health Science Center
Bachelor of Science in BiologyAmerican University of Beirut

She believes that her ability to be there and to provide support can have a long-lasting impact.
Clinical interests: Dr. Moussa's clinical interests include maternal medical complications during pregnancy, preterm birth and its prevention, as well as quality and safety improvement. On the fetal side, she is interested in fetal diagnosis and fetal neurodevelopment. During her fellowship training she focused her research on the fetal origins of autism etiology in relation to the maternal uterine environment, for which she received the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine excellence in research award. 
More about me: Dr. Moussa is family oriented and enjoys spending time with her daughter, and her niece and nephews. She is multilingual and fluent in Arabic, French and English. She enjoys community outreach both professionally and socially.

content.biography:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that persons individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Kelly appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so we may address your questions and educate you regarding the options of genetic testing. Kelly looks forward to talking with you.
education: Graduate EducationMaster's Degree | Medical Genetics | University of Cincinnati, Cincinnati, Ohio
Board CertificationGenetic Counseling | American Board of Genetic Counseling (Certifying Board and Agency)
content.media: News Links:One Minute Wellness - Cancer Genetics ProgramKnowledge is Power: Genetic Testing Helps Patients Take Control

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Carson Oostra, MD, MBA, is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.Dr. Oostra is board-certified in echocardiography, nuclear cardiology and internal medicine.Care philosophy: He encourages his patients to be their biggest advocate when it comes to their overall health. He feels that patients need to understand their conditions, know their medications and take an active role. Dr. Oostra strives to treat every patient with the same dedication as he would for a member of his family.Clinical interests: He has an interest in valvular heart disease, non-invasive cardiology, transesophageal echocardiography and imaging for patients considered for structural heart interventions.Conditions treated: Valvular (structural) heart disease, coronary artery disease, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and preventive heart disease with lifestyle modifications through diet and exercise.Procedures performed: Echocardiography, transesophageal echocardiography, nuclear cardiology and stress testing.More about me: Dr. Oostra grew up in Toledo, Ohio, and is proud to provide heart care in his community. He lives in the area with his wife and son and enjoys traveling and running.

More about me: Dr. Oostra grew up in Cincinnati, Ohio and spent most of her education and training between Cleveland and Columbus, truly Ohio born and raised. She moved to Toledo to be near family and is married with two children. She enjoys outdoor activities and her family's goal is to visit most, if not all, of the U.S. National Parks.
education: Medical SchoolNortheast Ohio Medical University, Rootstown, Ohio
Undergraduate EducationKent State University, Kent, Ohio

1 ProMedica Parkway, Entrance B, Floor 4
Toledo, Ohio 43606Get Directions
View Location Details

hospitalAffiliations.hospitalName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital

content.biography:
Anthony Palmer, MD, originally from Michigan, is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist. Pediatric Hematology / Oncology is a medical specialization in the diagnosis and treatment of both blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children. As a member of the Children's Oncology Group (COG), Dr. Palmer has an interest in providing access, whenever possible, to clinical trials for his patients.
Care philosophy: To involve each patient's family as a key part of the medical team. No single person can cure cancer in a child. It takes many supporting members from our comprehensive care team.
Conditions treated: All childhood and young adults cancers including: acute and chronic leukemia, lymphomas, bone tumors, sarcomas, brain tumors, germ cell tumors, Wilms tumors, neuroblastoma, liver tumors. Additional conditions include ITP, aplastic anemia, neutropenia and anemia.
Procedures performed: Lumbar punctures (spinal tap), bone marrow biopsy and aspirate.
education: Medical SchoolChicago Medical School, Rosalind Franklin University of Medicine and Science, Chicago, Illinois
Fellowship: Pediatric Hematology and OncologyUniversity of Michigan Medical School, Ann Arbor, Michigan
Residency: PediatricsUniversity of Michigan Medical School, Ann Arbor, Michigan
Master of Science: Applied PhysiologyRosalind Franklin University of Medicine and Science, Chicago, Illinois
Board CertificationGeneral Pediatrics and Pediatric Hematology and Oncology
University of Toledo AppointmentClinical Assistant Professor, Department of Pediatrics | UT College of Medicine and Life Sciences

title: Timothy Phelan MD - Cardiac Electrophysiology - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Timothy Phelan MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
additionalLocations:
ProMedica Physicians Cardiology - Monroe730 N. Macomb St.
Suite 429-A
Monroe, Michigan 48162Get Directions
View Location Details
content.biography:
Timothy Phelan, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Phelan is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking time to know his patients and to understand what is important to them. He also believes that not every treatment is the right choice for every patient.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia (VT), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), and cardiomyopathy.Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac ablations, pacemaker insertion, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator insertion, and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT/biventricular devices). 

More about me: His personal career interests include complex ablations of both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. In addition, he often participates in various multi-center research trials designed to improve future treatments for patients.

Dr. Phelan is originally from Baltimore, Maryland where most of his early medical education took place. He met his wife while they both were pursuing their medical training in Richmond, Virginia. He and his wife have both been practicing in the Toledo area since 2017.

title: Timothy Phelan MD - Cardiac Electrophysiology - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Timothy Phelan MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
additionalLocations:
ProMedica Physicians Cardiology - Monroe730 N. Macomb St.
Suite 429-A
Monroe, Michigan 48162Get Directions
View Location Details
content.biography:
Timothy Phelan, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Phelan is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking time to know his patients and to understand what is important to them. He also believes that not every treatment is the right choice for every patient.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia (VT), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), and cardiomyopathy.Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac ablations, pacemaker insertion, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator insertion, and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT/biventricular devices). 

More about me: His personal career interests include complex ablations of both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. In addition, he often participates in various multi-center research trials designed to improve future treatments for patients.

Dr. Phelan is originally from Baltimore, Maryland where most of his early medical education took place. He met his wife while they both were pursuing their medical training in Richmond, Virginia. He and his wife have both been practicing in the Toledo area since 2017.

conditionsProcedures: Arthritis of the foot and ankle
content.biography:
Matthew M. Reiner, DPM, is a fellowship trained foot and ankle specialist. He is board certified in foot and ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery. He completed his fellowship at the Northern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation in association with Orthopedic Associates of Lake County in Concord, Ohio. He completed his residency at St. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio where he served as chief resident.
Before graduating with his medical degree from the Kent State University College of Podiatric Medicine, he received the Wally Wiseman Surgical Excellence Award for Proficiency and Demonstrated Excellence in Podiatric Surgery. He also received the William F. Todd Award for Excellence in General Medicine. 
Dr. Reiner has specialized training in revision and reconstructive foot and ankle surgery, flatfoot correction, trauma of the foot and ankle, total ankle replacement surgery, and arthroscopic surgery of the ankle. He takes pride in exhausting non-surgical options before proceeding to surgical intervention and will devise a treatment plan based on your needs and lifestyle.
education: Medical SchoolKent State College of Podiatric Medicine, Independence, Ohio
ResidencySt. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio
FellowshipNorthern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation, Concord, Ohio

content.biography:
Kendall Reiter, LPCC, specializes in working with children and adolescents who struggle with social, emotional, and behavioral challenges throughout daily life. Some of her focus areas are issues related to trauma, mood disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), school stressors, anger management, and family and peer relationships.
Kendall has experience working with children in different settings, including school and group settings.Kendall obtained a master’s degree from the University of Toledo in clinical mental health counseling. Through her education and experience, she has established techniques to help provide a warm and inviting atmosphere for individuals to feel comfortable and safe. Kendall believes that developing a positive therapeutic relationship is key to the success of counseling for children and adolescents. Utilizing a number of evidence-based treatments such as cognitive-behavioral therapy, narrative therapy, motivational interviewing, play therapy, and art therapy, Kendall helps children and adolescents accomplish their goals.She has a passion for traveling and enjoys painting and drawing, taking long walks with her dog, and spending time with friends and family.
education: Bachelor of ArtsThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Master of Arts, Clinical Mental Health CounselingUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio

Matthew Rennels, DO is board certified in family medicine and sports medicine. He is committed to preventative medicine and disease prevention to help his patients maintain healthy and functional lifestyles. In addition to primary care, he has a special interest in musculoskeletal and sports medicine. His training in osteopathic manipulation, injections, ultrasound-guided injections and regenerative medicine treatments allow for his patients to achieve their best potential.
Dr. Rennels practices at both Wildwood Family Practice and Sports Medicine.  He is a team physician for local high schools and is an associate team physician at The University of Toledo.

title: Lauren Regueyra, MD - Obstetrics - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Lauren Regueyra MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Lauren Regueyra, MD, is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate. 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. 
More about me: Dr. Regueyra grew up in the Cincinnati, Ohio area. she returned to Toledo after spending the past several years living and working in Kansas City. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her husband and dog, cooking, being outdoors and reading.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
ResidencyOB/GYN, University of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio

conditionsProcedures: Arthritis of the foot and ankle
content.biography:
Matthew M. Reiner, DPM, is a fellowship trained foot and ankle specialist. He is board certified in foot and ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery. He completed his fellowship at the Northern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation in association with Orthopedic Associates of Lake County in Concord, Ohio. He completed his residency at St. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio where he served as chief resident.
Before graduating with his medical degree from the Kent State University College of Podiatric Medicine, he received the Wally Wiseman Surgical Excellence Award for Proficiency and Demonstrated Excellence in Podiatric Surgery. He also received the William F. Todd Award for Excellence in General Medicine. 
Dr. Reiner has specialized training in revision and reconstructive foot and ankle surgery, flatfoot correction, trauma of the foot and ankle, total ankle replacement surgery, and arthroscopic surgery of the ankle. He takes pride in exhausting non-surgical options before proceeding to surgical intervention and will devise a treatment plan based on your needs and lifestyle.
education: Medical SchoolKent State College of Podiatric Medicine, Independence, Ohio
ResidencySt. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio
FellowshipNorthern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation, Concord, Ohio

5800 Monroe St.
Suite G
Sylvania, OH 43560

content.biography:
Kendall Reiter, LPCC, specializes in working with children and adolescents who struggle with social, emotional, and behavioral challenges throughout daily life. Some of her focus areas are issues related to trauma, mood disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), school stressors, anger management, and family and peer relationships.
Kendall has experience working with children in different settings, including school and group settings.Kendall obtained a master’s degree from the University of Toledo in clinical mental health counseling. Through her education and experience, she has established techniques to help provide a warm and inviting atmosphere for individuals to feel comfortable and safe. Kendall believes that developing a positive therapeutic relationship is key to the success of counseling for children and adolescents. Utilizing a number of evidence-based treatments such as cognitive-behavioral therapy, narrative therapy, motivational interviewing, play therapy, and art therapy, Kendall helps children and adolescents accomplish their goals.She has a passion for traveling and enjoys painting and drawing, taking long walks with her dog, and spending time with friends and family.
education: Bachelor of ArtsThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Master of Arts, Clinical Mental Health CounselingUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio

Dr. Reiter believes that taking care of the entire family is key to good patient care. She also enjoys teaching medical students who can be found working with her on any given day. Dr. Reiter has been at this job since she graduated residency and plans on staying here for her career. Dr. Reiter loves to make quilts and most days off can be found working behind one of her six sewing machines.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Shirley Redfern, CNP is a certified nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiology.

Care philosophy: Shirley believes in treating people the way she would want to be treated. She respects the individuality and inherent dignity of those she cares for and encourages active participation by her patients in decisions regarding their health.

Clinical interests: Adult cardiology conditions including general cardiology, as well as electrophysiology, heart failure and interventional cardiology.

Conditions treated: Acute coronary syndromes, atrial fibrillation (AFib), coronary artery disease, heart failure, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension.

More about me: When not caring for others, she enjoys spending time with her husband and two daughters, along with friends and family.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingLourdes University
Master of Science in NursingUniversity of Toledo

title: Lauren Regueyra, MD - Obstetrics - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Lauren Regueyra MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Lauren Regueyra, MD, is a board-certified obstetrician/gynecologist (OB/GYN). 
Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate. 
Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. 
More about me: Dr. Regueyra grew up in the Cincinnati, Ohio area. she returned to Toledo after spending the past several years living and working in Kansas City. In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her husband and dog, cooking, being outdoors and reading.
education: Medical SchoolUniversity of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio
ResidencyOB/GYN, University of Toledo College of Medicine, Toledo, Ohio

conditionsProcedures: Arthritis of the foot and ankle
content.biography:
Matthew M. Reiner, DPM, is a fellowship trained foot and ankle specialist. He is board certified in foot and ankle surgery by the American Board of Foot and Ankle Surgery. He completed his fellowship at the Northern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation in association with Orthopedic Associates of Lake County in Concord, Ohio. He completed his residency at St. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio where he served as chief resident.
Before graduating with his medical degree from the Kent State University College of Podiatric Medicine, he received the Wally Wiseman Surgical Excellence Award for Proficiency and Demonstrated Excellence in Podiatric Surgery. He also received the William F. Todd Award for Excellence in General Medicine. 
Dr. Reiner has specialized training in revision and reconstructive foot and ankle surgery, flatfoot correction, trauma of the foot and ankle, total ankle replacement surgery, and arthroscopic surgery of the ankle. He takes pride in exhausting non-surgical options before proceeding to surgical intervention and will devise a treatment plan based on your needs and lifestyle.
education: Medical SchoolKent State College of Podiatric Medicine, Independence, Ohio
ResidencySt. Vincent Charity Medical Center, Cleveland, Ohio
FellowshipNorthern Ohio Foot and Ankle Foundation, Concord, Ohio

title: ProMedica Physicians Behavioral Health Sylvania

content.name: Kendall Reiter LPCC
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).

primaryLocation.locationAddress:
5800 Monroe St.
Suite G
Sylvania, OH 43560

content.biography:
Kendall Reiter, LPCC, specializes in working with children and adolescents who struggle with social, emotional, and behavioral challenges throughout daily life. Some of her focus areas are issues related to trauma, mood disorders, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), school stressors, anger management, and family and peer relationships.
Kendall has experience working with children in different settings, including school and group settings.Kendall obtained a master’s degree from the University of Toledo in clinical mental health counseling. Through her education and experience, she has established techniques to help provide a warm and inviting atmosphere for individuals to feel comfortable and safe. Kendall believes that developing a positive therapeutic relationship is key to the success of counseling for children and adolescents. Utilizing a number of evidence-based treatments such as cognitive-behavioral therapy, narrative therapy, motivational interviewing, play therapy, and art therapy, Kendall helps children and adolescents accomplish their goals.She has a passion for traveling and enjoys painting and drawing, taking long walks with her dog, and spending time with friends and family.
education: Bachelor of ArtsThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Master of Arts, Clinical Mental Health CounselingUniversity of Toledo, Toledo, Ohio

title: R. Karen Reiter MD - Family Medicine - Defiance, Ohio (OH)

content.name: R. Karen Reiter MD
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: R. Karen Reiter, MD was born and raised in northwest Ohio and her family is from the Defiance area where she currently works. Dr. Reiter is a family physician that also does non-surgical obstetrical care. She enjoys treating everyone from a newborn baby to her elderly patients. Dr. Reiter believes that taking care of the entire family is key to good patient care. She also enjoys teaching medical students who can be found working with her on any given day. Dr. Reiter has been at this job since she graduated residency and plans on staying here for her career. Dr. Reiter loves to make quilts and most days off can be found working behind one of her six sewing machines.
education: Medical SchoolThe University of Toledo College of Medicine

content.biography: Debra Remley is a board-certified psychiatric clinical nurse specialist with over 40 years experience. Her psychiatric career began in 1979 when the inpatient psychiatric unit opened at the hospital. She took a position at Monroe Community Mental Health for the next 17 years and it was a very rewarding experience for Debra. She also worked in local nursing homes providing psychiatric services to seniors.Debra is a native to Monroe and has spent her entire career working in Monroe County. She believes in giving back to the community.She believes change is hard work. Through evidence-based education, open communication with active listening, Debra finds fulfillment in watching her patients make choices to realize the full potential they seek in their lives.

content.biography:
Matthew Rennels, DO is board certified in family medicine and sports medicine. He is committed to preventative medicine and disease prevention to help his patients maintain healthy and functional lifestyles. In addition to primary care, he has a special interest in musculoskeletal and sports medicine. His training in osteopathic manipulation, injections, ultrasound-guided injections and regenerative medicine treatments allow for his patients to achieve their best potential.
Dr. Rennels practices at both Wildwood Family Practice and Sports Medicine.  He is a team physician for local high schools and is an associate team physician at The University of Toledo.

title: Melissa Schlotterer MA, BCBA, COBA - Applied Behavioral Analysis, Autism Spectrum Disorder - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Melissa Schlotterer MA, BCBA, COBA
content.services: Applied Behavioral Analysis, Autism Spectrum Disorder
content.location: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.biography: Melissa Schlotterer holds a master’s degree in Clinical Psychology, Applied Behavior Analysis, from The Chicago School of Professional Psychology and a bachelor’s degree in Education from Kent State University. Melissa is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst with 20 years of experience teaching and supervising programs for children with autism in a variety of settings throughout Ohio, Washington D.C., and Chicago. After spending many years supervising school and home based behavioral programs in Chicago, Melissa began working for the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center in 2013 and is currently the Director of Autism Programs and Services. Melissa has presented on topics related to autism and other developmental disabilities at national conferences and within different communities. Her thesis research is published in the journal, Behavioral Interventions. Melissa is originally from North West Ohio and is very passionate about being an integral part of ensuring all children within this community have access to the highest quality of services to enhance growth and learning. Melissa and her husband live in Port Clinton with their two young children. Melissa enjoys spending time with her family and friends and taking advantage of everything living on the lake has to offer.

content.biography:
Mischell Schlosser, CNP is an advanced practice registered nurse and certified nurse practitioner who specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Care philosophy: Mischell believes in patient-centered and collaborative care. She wants her patients to understand their disease process and actively participate and take ownership of their own health. title: Melissa Schlotterer MA, BCBA, COBA - Applied Behavioral Analysis, Autism Spectrum Disorder - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Melissa Schlotterer MA, BCBA, COBA
content.services: Applied Behavioral Analysis, Autism Spectrum Disorder
content.location: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

primaryLocation.locationName: ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children's Hospital Finnegan Family Autism Center

content.biography: Melissa Schlotterer holds a master’s degree in Clinical Psychology, Applied Behavior Analysis, from The Chicago School of Professional Psychology and a bachelor’s degree in Education from Kent State University. Melissa is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst with 20 years of experience teaching and supervising programs for children with autism in a variety of settings throughout Ohio, Washington D.C., and Chicago. After spending many years supervising school and home based behavioral programs in Chicago, Melissa began working for the ProMedica Finnegan Family Autism Center in 2013 and is currently the Director of Autism Programs and Services. Melissa has presented on topics related to autism and other developmental disabilities at national conferences and within different communities. Her thesis research is published in the journal, Behavioral Interventions. Melissa is originally from North West Ohio and is very passionate about being an integral part of ensuring all children within this community have access to the highest quality of services to enhance growth and learning. Melissa and her husband live in Port Clinton with their two young children. Melissa enjoys spending time with her family and friends and taking advantage of everything living on the lake has to offer.

content.biography: Caitlin Scannell, PA-C has been a practicing physician assistant for nearly 10 years, with 7 years in orthopaedic surgery. She is passionate about communication in order to meet patients where they are and enhance their understanding of their injury to facilitate recovery. Her favorite procedures include ACL reconstructions, labral repairs, and total knee arthroplasty. Caitlin grew up in Toledo and now enjoys being part of the community and giving back of her time and talent. She is also a 200 hour registered yoga teacher having completed training in the winter of 2021 at Toledo Yoga. On the weekends, you may find her at one of the Toledo Metroparks walking her Bernese Mountain dog.

title: Gayla Sholey CNM - Midwifery - Fremont, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Gayla Sholey CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography:
Gayla Sholey, CNM is a certified nurse-midwife. Midwives are trained professionals who provide reproductive primary care and who help women with lower-risk pregnancies deliver their babies with few medical interventions. Her specialty is in routine obstetrics and gynecology care. Care philosophy: Meeting women where they are with regard to learning and health readiness for their well-being and listening.

Clinical interests: Caring for under-served populations inclusive of migrant population and women affected by substance use disorder.

More about me: Gayla's training included time at University Hospital in Cleveland, Planned Parenthood, St. Luke’s Hospital, Mercy Midwives, as well as a mission trip to Guatemala. In her spare time, she enjoys crafting, sewing, gardening, baking and spending time with her five children and grandchildren.

content.biography:
Henry Silverman III, MD is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Silverman is board-certified in cardiovascular diseases and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in treating each patient with great respect and intellectual honesty. He also believes in basing his recommendations on evidence/data whenever possible while taking each patient's individual situation, other medical issues, and preferences into account.Conditions treated: Cardiovascular diseases and rhythm disturbances, congenital heart disease, preventative cardiology, and follow-up care.Procedures/treatments performed: Non-invasive procedures (echocardiograms, nuclear cardiac imaging studies with exercise testing or chemical/pharmacologic stress testing, plain treadmill stress testing, and stress echo cardiograms either on treadmill or chemical/pharmacologic), Holter and event monitors and resting EKGs, diagnostic cardiac catheterizations, elective cardioversions, 3D echocardiograms and myocardial strain measurements.

More about me: Toledo, Ohio is Dr. Silverman's hometown and where he practiced cardiology from 1981 till 2004. He then joined ProMedica in Adrian, Michigan where he sees patients in the office regularly. He also performs cardiology consults in the hospital exclusively at ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital in Lenawee, Michigan.

Dr. Silverman has served on the Alumni Board of Governors for the Ohio State College of Medicine for the last several years. He is also a die-hard Buckeyes fan. Both he and his father attended Ohio State University Medical School and Dr. Silverman was 6 years old when he attended his father's graduation. Dr. Silverman says his father was an outstanding family practitioner in Toledo and was a great influence on him. He says he is blessed to have had him as his father and mentor.
education: Medical SchoolOhio State University College of Medicine

title: Mildred (Millie) Silvestri CNM - Midwifery - Toledo, Ohio (OH)

content.name: Mildred (Millie) Silvestri CNM
content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Mildred (Millie) Silvestri, is a Certified Nurse Midwife and Women’s Health Nurse Practitioner, recently returning to the Toledo area after working as a labor and delivery nurse and training in Chicago, IL. Her love for the birth process began at a young age, hearing her mother who had nine deliveries herself, tell each child their birth story at every birthday.Her care philosophy is to treat patients the way she would her own family member, and to always listen with purpose. She is passionate about providing obstetrics and gynecologic care to patients of all ages, in all different aspects of life, and she has a strong clinical interest in making the labor process as patient centered as possible. Her doctoral research project was conducted in Chicago, IL regarding educating staff nurses on the benefits of movement and position changes in labor. Millie is excited to have returned to Toledo to serve the community she grew up in.
education: Bachelor of Science in NursingThe Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
Doctorate of Nursing PracticeUniversity of Illinois, Chicago, Illinois

content.biography:
Jobst Vascular Institute is a world-renown vascular center that provides patients access to comprehensive vascular services including: vascular testing, vascular rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, clinical trials, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.
The physicians of ProMedica Physicians Jobst Vascular and Jobst Vascular Institute all are board certified in vascular disease. With 15 office locations across northwest Ohio and southeast Michigan, we are committed to providing our patients and their families with high quality, innovative, and patient-centered care. 
Richard Simman, MD, FACS, FACCWS, recently joined Monroe’s medical community after providing comprehensive plastic and reconstructive surgery in Dayton, Ohio, for 14 years. During his career, he has performed thousands of cases in both aesthetic and trauma surgery. He has additional expertise in head and neck surgery, surgical treatment of skin malignancies, and management and reconstruction of complex wounds.
Dr. Simman's skill and special interest in education and research led to his clinical professorship of plastic and reconstructive surgery, surgical dermatology, pharmacology and toxicology at Wright State University Boonshoft School of Medicine.

content.badge: This provider is an employee of ProMedica Physician Group (PPG).
content.biography: Jennifer Simmons, MS, APRN, WHNP, developed her passion for women’s health and oncology while working in breast and ovarian cancer research. She has been working as a Women’s Health Nurse Practitioner for over 20 years, with over seven years NP experience in breast surgery and 13 years experience in outpatient OB/GYN. In addition, she also has RN experience in inpatient hematology/oncology and labor and delivery. Jennifer considers it to be both a privilege and pleasure to help others. She enjoys helping patients live their best possible lives and supporting them through their breast cancer journey. In her spare time, Jennifer enjoys being outdoors, running, swimming, biking, paddle boarding, and spending time with family and friends.

content.biography: Kerri Simo, MD is the region’s first fellowship-trained hepatopancreatobiliary (HPB) surgeon. HPB surgery is a surgical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and surgical treatment of both malignant and benign diseases of the liver, pancreas and gallbladder. She also has additional fellowship training in liver and kidney transplant as well as liver, biliary and pancreas surgery.Dr. Simo’s clinical interest include minimally invasive liver and pancreas surgery, microwave ablation and irreversible electroporation. She is involved on a national and international level to expand the adaptation of laparoscopic and robotic liver surgery as well as clinical trials to advance the surgical treatment of liver and pancreas cancers. Within her first year of practice here at ProMedica she established and continues to run a support group for post-Whipple patients.Dr. Simo’s hobbies include reading and running ultramarathons.
